document_data.mainbody:
arantarns Chairs and Stools was the shop of the master carpenter and furniture-maker Ommagol Larantarn of Sundabar, circa 1365 DR.
Specializing in, as his shops name states, wooden chairs and stools, 
Ommagols shop featured heavy tapestries that hung upon the walls, and scattered across the floor. As he would turn chair legs on the lathe, Ommagol would fling them over his shoulder while drinking wine and singing.
